Description: Blue glazed composition finger-ring: made up for four open-work seated falcon-headed figures either side of an 'ankh'-sign and a seated goddess, possibly Hathor, with horns on her head and holding a wand. The gods hold 'maat'-feathers. They are separated by vertical lines with dots between. The ring is slightly elliptical in section and the glazing is not all the same colour, varying from a bright blue to a light green.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 37 Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.45
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands
Funder name: With contribution from: Art Fund (as NACF)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev George Denis Nash
